meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: The release of elizaOS v1.0.7 with significant architecture improvements marks a critical stabilization milestone, though users report responsiveness issues requiring immediate attention.

key_points.summary: The release of elizaOS v1.0.7 introduced major architectural improvements, but several users are reporting agent responsiveness issues and plugin functionality problems that may impact user retention and growth.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize addressing the reported agent responsiveness issues in v1.0.7 versus continuing development on v2?
context: Multiple users reported problems with agent responsiveness after upgrading to v1.0.7 (Discord 2025-06-09)
Current Monthly Directive: Ship production ready elizaOS v2

answer_1.text: Immediately roll back to v1.0.6 while resolving the responsiveness issues in v1.0.7 before resuming v2 development.
answer_1.implication: This ensures user stability at the cost of delaying v2 development and potential feature advantages.

answer_2.text: Rapidly develop and release a v1.0.8 patch while maintaining parallel v2 development with separate teams.
answer_2.implication: This balanced approach addresses both immediate stability concerns and long-term progress, but may strain resources.

answer_3.text: Continue v2 development with priority, incorporating v1.0.7 fixes directly into the v2 release rather than patching v1.
answer_3.implication: This accelerates v2 delivery but risks user attrition if stability issues persist in the current release.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What approach should we take to resolve the knowledge plugin functionality issues that remain unimplemented in v1.0.7?
context: Knowledge Plugin Fixes: wookosh offered to contribute to fixing knowledge plugin bugs, Kenk offered to assign GitHub contributor status after PR submission (Discord 2025-06-09)
harperaa: 'Knowledge management (RAG) not working (implemented) in 1.0.6...' (Issue #5004)

answer_1.text: Prioritize fixing knowledge plugin issues internally with dedicated elizaOS team resources before the next release.
answer_1.implication: This ensures quality control but may delay other development aspects due to resource allocation.

answer_2.text: Accept and support the community contribution offered by wookosh while providing guidance and reviewing the implementation.
answer_2.implication: This leverages community resources and builds engagement while maintaining oversight of critical components.

answer_3.text: Defer RAG functionality to v2 and communicate this decision clearly to users as part of the architectural upgrade path.
answer_3.implication: This simplifies the v1 maintenance burden but may disappoint users who expected this feature in the current version.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What strategy should we implement for handling Twitter integration issues to boost agent visibility for auto.fun?
context: Twitter Integration Support: nasdaq.ai suggested reducing items to review and modifying prompts to one action per tweet to resolve timeline issues (Discord 2025-06-09)
Fix Twitter plugin issues as outlined in PRs (jonas) (Discord 2025-06-09)

answer_1.text: Implement nasdaq.ai's suggestions to reduce complexity and focus on reliable single-action tweets for immediate stability.
answer_1.implication: This provides a quick fix for visibility but may limit the sophistication of agent interactions on Twitter.

answer_2.text: Develop a completely redesigned Twitter integration for v2 with more robust handling of complex interactions and API limitations.
answer_2.implication: This creates a more capable long-term solution but delays improvements to current Twitter visibility crucial for auto.fun.

answer_3.text: Create an interim simplified Twitter plugin variant specifically optimized for auto.fun promotional content while maintaining the full plugin for power users.
answer_3.implication: This dual-track approach addresses immediate marketing needs while preserving advanced functionality for developers.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Community discussions suggest growing interest in AI agent narratives and potential opportunities for auto.fun, but there are concerns about partner project status and integration between elizaOS and the auto.fun ecosystem.

deliberation_items.text: How should we address the reported issues with 'dead' partner projects to strengthen the auto.fun ecosystem?
context: Concerns were raised about 'dead' partner projects that need addressing (cloudAI) (Discord 2025-06-09)
References to 'autodotfun' as an innovative platform with favorable fee structures (Discord 2025-06-09)

answer_1.text: Implement formal partner project review processes with clear activity metrics and revoke inactive partnerships.
answer_1.implication: This creates quality control but may reduce the perceived size of our ecosystem in the short term.

answer_2.text: Develop a rejuvenation program with targeted support and incentives for stalled partner projects to become active again.
answer_2.implication: This salvages existing relationships and investments but requires additional resources for potentially low-yield efforts.

answer_3.text: Focus exclusively on onboarding new, more active partners while naturally allowing inactive projects to fade from visibility.
answer_3.implication: This prioritizes growth with fresh projects but may create reputational risk from abandoned partnerships.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How can we capitalize on the predicted rise of AI agent narratives in coming months to position auto.fun for maximum growth?
context: Speculation that AI agent narratives will become prominent in coming months (Discord 2025-06-09)
References to 'ai16z ecosystem' potentially benefiting from upcoming trends (Discord 2025-06-09)

answer_1.text: Launch a coordinated marketing campaign highlighting auto.fun's pioneering position in the AI agent ecosystem and its token advantages.
answer_1.implication: This proactive approach may capture early narrative momentum but requires significant marketing resources.

answer_2.text: Focus on showcasing impressive technical demonstrations of agent capabilities on auto.fun to attract attention from AI researchers and developers.
answer_2.implication: This builds credibility with the technical community but may not fully capitalize on broader market narrative opportunities.

answer_3.text: Accelerate the launch of high-profile partnerships and agent templates that make it easier for projects to deploy compelling AI agents on auto.fun.
answer_3.implication: This ecosystem approach leverages partners' marketing efforts but requires sharing the spotlight and potential revenue.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What approach should we take to improve multilingual capabilities to expand the global reach of elizaOS and auto.fun?
context: Jin is working on Korean and Chinese language capabilities, sharing samples for community feedback (Discord 2025-06-09)
Void (native Korean speaker) provided feedback on Korean language sample quality (Discord 2025-06-09)
辞尘鸽鸽 committed to providing accuracy feedback on upcoming Chinese samples (Discord 2025-06-09)

answer_1.text: Prioritize perfecting Korean and Chinese language support before expanding to additional languages, ensuring high quality over quantity.
answer_1.implication: This depth-first approach ensures quality in key Asian markets but delays broader global accessibility.

answer_2.text: Rapidly expand to support multiple languages simultaneously with community validation, accepting initial quality limitations for broader reach.
answer_2.implication: This breadth-first strategy maximizes global accessibility but risks inconsistent quality across language implementations.

answer_3.text: Focus multilingual efforts primarily on auto.fun's interface and marketing while maintaining English as the primary development language for elizaOS.
answer_3.implication: This targeted approach prioritizes user acquisition channels while maintaining development efficiency.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: The developer community shows strong interest in contributing to elizaOS, but needs clearer pathways for engagement and better processes for handling contributions, particularly for core functionality like knowledge plugins.

deliberation_items.text: How should we formalize the process for community members to become contributors to the elizaOS ecosystem?
context: Q: Is there a process to become a contributor? A: 'Just make a PR and ship a good change' (cjft) (Discord 2025-06-09)
wookosh offered to contribute to fixing knowledge plugin bugs, Kenk offered to assign GitHub contributor status after PR submission (Discord 2025-06-09)

answer_1.text: Maintain the current informal approach of 'just make a PR' to minimize barriers to contribution while providing feedback as needed.
answer_1.implication: This keeps contribution accessible but may result in variable quality contributions requiring significant review resources.

answer_2.text: Implement a structured contributor program with clear guidelines, mentorship, and progression paths from small fixes to core component ownership.
answer_2.implication: This creates a talent pipeline and quality control system but adds administrative overhead and potential contribution barriers.

answer_3.text: Develop a hybrid approach with minimal barriers for small contributions but a formal application process for accessing critical components or becoming core contributors.
answer_3.implication: This balances accessibility and quality control but requires maintaining two parallel contribution systems.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What strategy should we adopt for supporting and growing the multilingual community around elizaOS?
context: Q: Is there a Spanish channel? A: 'si' (Miller | Crypto Analyst ₿/🎮) (Discord 2025-06-09)
Jin is working on Korean and Chinese language capabilities, sharing samples for community feedback (Discord 2025-06-09)

answer_1.text: Establish dedicated language-specific channels with community managers who can bridge language barriers and coordinate localization efforts.
answer_1.implication: This creates tailored community spaces but requires significant coordination resources and risks fragmenting the community.

answer_2.text: Focus on improving translation tools and documentation rather than separate channels, keeping a unified community with multilingual support.
answer_2.implication: This maintains community cohesion but may not provide the comfortable engagement environment needed for non-English speakers.

answer_3.text: Implement an AI-assisted translation layer across all channels to enable real-time cross-lingual communication without segregating the community.
answer_3.implication: This innovative approach showcases our technology but depends on unreliable translation quality and increases technical complexity.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we resolve the tension between shipping v2 quickly versus ensuring backwards compatibility with v1 plugins and use cases?
context: PR for Knowledge Plugin: A significant pull request (#17) was opened to fix issues in the knowledge plugin (Discord 2025-06-09)
ElizaOS v1.0.7 Released: Users were instructed to update by running 'npm i -g @elizaos/cli' (cjft) (Discord 2025-06-09)
Custom Plugin Development: Users discussed implementation methods for custom plugins (Discord 2025-06-08)

answer_1.text: Prioritize full backwards compatibility in v2, even if it means delaying the release to ensure all v1 plugins continue to function.
answer_1.implication: This protects user investments but may constrain architectural improvements and extend the development timeline.

answer_2.text: Focus on innovation in v2 with limited compatibility, providing clear migration guides and tools to help users update their implementations.
answer_2.implication: This enables bolder improvements but creates migration friction and potential user frustration.

answer_3.text: Develop v2 with a dual-mode runtime that supports both legacy v1 plugins and new v2 capabilities with a gradual deprecation timeline.
answer_3.implication: This balances innovation and compatibility but increases complexity and maintenance burden.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
